alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 8:22PM CDT until June 26 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Kimball County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Southwestern Banner County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... East central Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 800 PM MDT. * At 722 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Albin, or 25 miles northwest of Kimball, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Kimball, Albin, Oliver Campground, Oliver Reservoir, Kimball Airport, Harrisburg and Bushnell. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 16 and 24. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.
